title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is cited as the short title. The authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture is transferred to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transferred the authority to conduct a census of agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary is required to conduct a census every 5 years, starting in 1998, using surveys and statistical methods as necessary. Non-compliance with answering census questions may result in penalties under United States Code. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transferred the authority to conduct a census of agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Non-compliance with answering census questions may result in penalties under United States Code, including penalties for refusing to answer questions or providing false information. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transferred the authority to conduct a census of agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Each census under this subsection shall include each State, the District of Columbia, and other areas over which the United States exercises jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce may furnish information collected under title 13, United States Code, upon request of the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of State's concurrence is required for areas under US jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture can also provide information to the Secretary of Commerce for census purposes. The Secretary of Commerce can provide census information to the Secretary of Agriculture. Any information shared must only be used for statistical purposes. Rules for implementation can be set by the respective Secretaries. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, is repealed as of October 1, 1998. Effective October 1, 1998, section 142 of title 13, United States Code is repealed. Additionally, section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. Information is amended regarding the authority to furnish information to the Department of Agriculture and Department of Commerce under specific sections of the United States Code and the Food Security Act of 1985. The confidentiality of information is addressed in these amendments. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to allow the Department of Commerce to release information under specific statutes. Information furnished under these statutes will be treated as confidential for certain purposes under title 13 of the United States Code. The Food Security Act of 1985 amended to allow Department of Commerce to release confidential information under specific statutes. Passed by the House of Representatives on July 22, 1996.
